title: For Rent
description: A story about a rent-a-friend service in Tokyo

chapters.title: 渋谷の迷子犬とビラの山
chapters.description: Flyering job unexpectedly becomes a heartwarming lost puppy rescue mission.

sentences.レンタル田中、今日の任務はビラ配り。: Rental Tanaka's mission today is distributing flyers.
sentences.千円の時給で、人の視線を避けるプロになった気分だ。: For 1,000 yen an hour, I feel like I've become a professional at avoiding people's gaze.
sentences.皆、まるで幽霊でも見るかのように私を避ける。: Everyone avoids me as if I were a ghost.
sentences.退屈なノルマにうんざりしながら、足元に目をやった。: Feeling fed up with the dull quota, I glanced down at my feet.
sentences.茶色い毛玉が、小さく震えている。: A brown furball was trembling slightly.
sentences.こんな喧騒の中で、よくまあ生きているものだ。: It's amazing it's alive in such chaos.
sentences.私と一緒で、ここが居場所じゃないのに、ここにいる。: Just like me, it's here even though this isn't where it belongs.
sentences.手にはまだビラがずっしり。: The flyers in my hand still felt heavy.
sentences.しかし、このまま放っておくのも寝覚めが悪い。: But leaving it like this would weigh on my conscience.
sentences.結局、ため息一つ、ビラの束を脇に抱え、子犬を拾い上げた。: In the end, with a sigh, I tucked the bundle of flyers under my arm and picked up the puppy.
sentences.掌の上の小さな命。: A tiny life in my palm.
sentences.ポケットでスマホが震える。: My smartphone vibrates in my pocket.

chapters.title: 小さな命、大きな依頼
chapters.description: Puppy complicates new formal stand-in gig.

sentences.渋谷の雑踏を抜け、子犬を抱えながらスマホを覗く。: Pushing through the Shibuya crowds, I peered at my smartphone, a puppy cradled in my arms.
sentences.場所は都内の高級ホテル、ドレスコードは『フォーマル』。: The location was a luxury hotel in Tokyo, and the dress code was 'formal'.
sentences.私のいつものレンタル衣装じゃ無理だし、そもそも、この子が…。: My usual rented outfits wouldn't work for this, and then there's *him*...
sentences.抱きかかえた子犬が、クンクン鼻を鳴らし、私のTシャツの裾を甘噛みする。: The puppy in my arms whimpered softly and gently nipped the hem of my T-shirt.
sentences.さっきまでの大人しさはどこへやら、元気いっぱいの『営業妨害』だ。: Gone was the quiet demeanor it had just moments ago; it was now a lively 'business obstruction'.
sentences.「まさか犬同伴で披露宴に出るわけにもいかないしね。: I can't possibly attend a wedding reception with a dog, can I?
sentences.この小さな命をどうするか。: What to do with this small life?
sentences.依頼まであと3時間。: Only three hours until the assignment.
sentences.とりあえず、最寄りのペットホテルを検索する指が、妙に震えていた。: My finger, as I searched for the nearest pet hotel, was strangely trembling.

chapters.title: 迷子の足跡と不思議な縁
chapters.description: エミコ、風変わりな店で子犬の意外な解決策を見つける。

sentences.迫り来る３時間のタイムリミットに、エミコは焦っていた。: Emiko was frantic as the three-hour deadline loomed.
sentences.スマホで検索したペットホテルは、どこも「本日満室」か「予約必須」の表示ばかり。: Every pet hotel she searched for on her smartphone showed either "No Vacancy Today" or "Reservations Required."
sentences.抱きかかえた子犬は、時折小さな声で鳴き、エミコの焦燥感をさらに煽る。: The puppy she held in her arms occasionally whimpered, further fueling Emiko's growing anxiety.
sentences.渋谷の裏通りをさまよっていると、場末のスナックとコインランドリーの間に、奇妙な看: Wandering through the back streets of Shibuya, she spotted a strange sign nestled between a rundown snack bar and a laundromat.
sentences.「何でも相談所 兼 骨董品 兼 猫カフェ（仮）」と手書きされたそれは、まさしく多: Hand-written with "Anything Consultation Office & Antiques & Cat Cafe (Provisional)," it truly presented itself as a multi-purpose shop.
sentences.「あの…すみません」エミコが引き戸を開けると、中には埃っぽい骨董品と、気まぐれに: "Excuse me..." Emiko said as she slid open the door. Inside were dusty antiques and several cats whimsically strolling through the shop.
sentences.奥から現れたのは、色褪せたアロハシャツを着た白髪の男性だった。: From the back emerged a white-haired man wearing a faded Aloha shirt.
sentences.」店主はエミコが口を開く前に、子犬に目を向けた。: the proprietor said, looking at the puppy before Emiko could speak.
sentences.「仕事の間だけ預かってくれる所を探していて…」 すると店主はニヤリと笑った。: "I'm looking for a place that can look after it just while I'm at work..." The proprietor then grinned.
sentences.うちはペットホテルじゃないが、その子、しばらく見ててあげてもいいよ。: "We're not a pet hotel, but I can look after the little one for a while.
sentences.タダとはいかないが、面白いものがあるからね…」: It won't be free, but I have something interesting in mind..."

chapters.title: 奇妙な対価と急務
chapters.description: Owner's odd payment reveals attire solution, challenging Emiko.

sentences.「さて、子犬の預かりの件ですが…」エミコは言いかけた。: "Well, about taking care of the puppy..." Emiko began.
sentences.店主はにこやかに首を振る。: The shop owner smiled and shook his head.
sentences.その代わり、一つ、私の店で『お仕事』をお願いしたい」 「お仕事？: "Instead, I'd like to ask you for a 'job' here at my shop." "A 'job'?
sentences.何でも屋の彼女だが、この男が何を要求するか読めない。: Though she ran an odd-jobs business, she couldn't tell what this man would demand.
sentences.「ええ、まさに『レンタル田中』さんの出番です」店主は奥の薄暗い一角を指差した。: "Yes, it's precisely 'Rental Tanaka's' turn to shine," the shop owner said, pointing to a dimly lit corner in the back.
sentences.「あそこにいらっしゃるお客様に、少しばかりお付き合い願いたい」 見ると、そこには: "I'd like you to keep the customer over there company for a little while." When she looked, an old Japanese doll, dressed in a lavish kimono, was solemnly seated there.
sentences.それと、どうせなら格好良く決めていただきたい」店主はニヤリと笑い、店の奥から古び: "And, while you're at it, I'd like you to look sharp." The shop owner grinned and pulled an old paulownia chest of drawers from the back of the shop.
sentences.中には、埃をかぶってはいるものの、上質な仕立てのフォーマルなワンピースが数着収ま: Inside, though covered in dust, were several finely tailored formal dresses.
sentences.「これで、次のお仕事の衣装も解決ですね！: "With this, your outfit for the next job is also sorted out!
sentences.エミコは呆然とするしかなかった。: Emiko could only stare in a daze.
sentences.まさか、人形相手の奇妙なレンタル依頼が、ドレス問題の解決策になるとは。: She never imagined that a bizarre rental request for a doll would be the solution to her dress problem.

chapters.title: 沈黙の対話 (Chinmoku no Taiwa)
chapters.description: Emiko talks to doll, subtly revealing self.

sentences.えみこは、再び目の前の人形に目を向けた。: Emiko looked at the doll in front of her again.
sentences.何を話せばいいのか、さっぱり見当がつかない。: She had no idea what to talk about.
sentences.「えーと…今日も、いいお天気ですね？: "Uhm... It's nice weather today too, isn't it?"
sentences.」 自分で言ってて馬鹿らしくなる。: Saying it herself made her feel ridiculous.
sentences.しかし、ここで引き下がるわけにはいかない。: But she couldn't back down now.
sentences.「あのですね、私、『レンタル田中』っていう名前で仕事をしてるんです。: "Well, you see, I work under the name 'Rental Tanaka'."
sentences.色々な人の『代わり』になるのが仕事でして。: My job is to be a 'substitute' for various people.
sentences.例えば、誰かの話を聞くだけとか、時には恋人のフリをしたり…。: For example, just listening to someone, or sometimes pretending to be their lover...
sentences.」 言葉が滑らかに出始めた。: Her words began to flow smoothly.
sentences.店主の男は、相変わらず黙ってこちらを見ている。: The shop owner was still silently watching her.
sentences.その視線は、評価しているのか、ただ面白いものを見ているだけなのか、判別がつかない: She couldn't tell if his gaze was evaluating her, or if he was simply watching something amusing.
sentences.「感情とか、余計なものを入れなければ、案外楽なもんです。: "If you don't get emotions or other unnecessary things involved, it's surprisingly easy."
sentences.だけど…」 ふと、先ほど抱き上げた仔犬の、あの温かい重みを思い出した。: "But..." Suddenly, she remembered the warm weight of the puppy she had picked up earlier.
sentences.「…どうして私がこんな話をしてるんでしょうね。: "...Why am I even talking about this?"
sentences.人形は相変わらず、涼しい顔でそこにいた。: The doll remained there, as impassive as ever.

chapters.title: 奇妙な対話、揺れる心 (Strange Dialogue, Wavering Heart)
chapters.description: Doll conversation deepens; Emiko's detachment wavers.

sentences.「…だから、あなたは何も言わないから楽ですよね」と、恵美子は日本人形に語りかけた: Emiko addressed the Japanese doll, saying, "...It's easy, isn't it, because you never say anything?"
sentences.無表情な人形は相変わらず黙って座っている。: The expressionless doll remained seated in silence, as always.
sentences.「私はいつも、相手の期待に応えるための役を演じているだけ。: I'm always just playing a role to meet others' expectations.
sentences.田中さん、とか、お姉さん、とか、誰かになりきる。: I fully embody someone else—a 'Mr. Tanaka,' or 'Big Sister,' or whoever.
sentences.文学部の頃は、登場人物になりきって小説を読むのが好きだったのに…今じゃ、自分が登: When I was in the literature department, I used to love immersing myself in novels by becoming the characters... but now, I feel like *I'm* the character.
sentences.しかも、特に物語もないような」 「ほう、物語がない、か。: And what's more, it's as if there's no real story to it." "Oh, no story, you say?"
sentences.それはまだ、見えていないだけかもしれませんな」 恵美子はハッと顔を上げた。: Perhaps it just hasn't revealed itself to you yet." Emiko gasped and looked up.
sentences.店主はいつの間にか近くに立っていて、にこやかにこちらを見ていた。: Unnoticed, the shop owner had come to stand nearby, looking at her with a smile.
sentences.その目は、人形と恵美子の間で交わされた（一方的な）会話の全てを見透かしているかの: His eyes seemed to peer right through every detail of the (one-sided) conversation that had passed between the doll and Emiko.
sentences.恵美子の心臓が小さく跳ねた。: Emiko's heart gave a little leap.
sentences.そして、この奇妙な空間で、自分は何を暴かれようとしているのか。: And in this peculiar space, what was about to be exposed about her?
sentences.ただのバイトのはずなのに、なぜこんなに感情が揺さぶられるのだろう。: It was supposed to be just a part-time job, so why were her emotions so deeply stirred?
sentences.子犬の温もりを思い出し、胸の奥で何かがざわめいた。: Recalling the warmth of the puppy, something stirred deep within her chest.
